diagnosis.differential_diagnosis: schizophrenia, chronic undifferentiated type; hysterical psychosis; hypomania with borderline mental retardation; schizo-affective psychosis
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patients exhibited recurrent mood swings, periods of mania or hypomania, and behavioral changes that were indicative of manic-depressive illness, which was often overlooked due to their mental retardation. Close observation and thorough history-taking, including insights from family members, helped clarify the diagnosis despite initial attributions of symptoms to mental retardation.
